subject: Personal Finance
title: Longevity Risk
description: A short lesson to help you apply Longevity Risk.

hook.text: A 65-year-old today has a 50% chance of living past 85 and a 25% chance of reaching 92. Plan accordingly.

buildup.text: Longevity risk is the danger of outliving your money. It's the defining risk of retirement.

discovery.text: Planning for a 30-year retirement seems conservative. But for couples, one partner often lives that long.

twist.text: Healthcare costs accelerate in the final years. The last five years of life can be the most expensive.

climax.text: Annuities, delayed Social Security, and conservative withdrawal rates all hedge against living too long.

punchline.text: The risk isn't dying. It's living longer than your money.

quiz.question: What is longevity risk?
options: The risk of outliving your retirement savings
